DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective of the study is to compare motor strength in knee extension between two groups of patients. One group receiving a proximal thigh block of the femoral nerve, and one receiving a distal thigh block of the saphenous nerve. The secondary objective is to compare the pain relief and functional outcomes in these two groups.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Femoral vs Saphenous Nerve Blocks on Function After ACL Repair
DOC.criteria: 1. Age 1865 2. Upcoming ACL reconstruction using patellar tendon autograft scheduled at Hershey Medical Center or the Hershey Outpatient Surgical Center (HOSC) 1. Documented neuropathy 2. Skeletally immature 3. Previous knee surgery 4. Inability to provide informed consent 5. ACL reconstruction with other tendon repairs
DOC.keyword: nerve blocks in Anterior cruciate ligament surgery
